binaryGA

Class BinaryGA

  • java.lang.Object
    • binaryGA.BinaryGA

  • public class BinaryGA
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class BinaryGA demonstrates the genetic algorithm which predict which line segments are suppose to join to form a large line segment where we conduct as many trials as possible to get a desired result.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean adjacentDashes(Dash ls1, Dash ls2)
      Checks whether 2 Line Segs are adjacent measures the distance between the 2 nearest point from the 2 Line segs compares the distance against dash separation!
      static boolean colinearDashes(Dash ls1, Dash ls2)
      Checks whether 2 Line Segs are colinear finds the two furthest points of the 2 line segs, creates an imaginary line measure the dist between the other 2 points and this line compares the distance against radius of colinearity roc

      This method evaluates the the nth member of the population If score is -1, then we have a good GA which has solved the problem domain

      • listIsDashedLine

        public static int listIsDashedLine(java.util.List<Dash> lsList)
        Checks whether a list of Dashes forms a dashed line The idea is to compare the 1st element of the list against the 2nd, the 2nd against the 3rd and so on. We do these pairwise comparisons and check whether each pair is colinear and adjacent We count the number of colinear and adjacent pairs if the number is 4 then these line segments form a dashed line (remember we do 4 pairwise comparisons when we have 5 elements)
        Parameters:
        lsList - a list of Dashes
        Returns:
        value the number of consecutive colinear and adjacent LineSegments (dashes)

      • runGA

        public static void runGA()
        Runs the Microbial GA to solve the problem domain Where the problem domain is specified as follows You have coordinates of 10 line segments You have to divide them into 2 groups each of which forms a dashed line.

      • evalSolution

        public static int evalSolution(int n)
        This method evaluates the the nth member of the population If score is -1, then we have a good GA which has solved the problem domain
        Parameters:
        n - the nth member of the population
        Returns:
        value the score for this member of the population

        public static boolean colinearDashes(Dash ls1,
